column2: ENGLISH
You must personally lead exploration parties. They will be disbanded if you are not in command.
Until you secure a landed title, your hidden workshop will remain in the province where you first arrived.
Advising a powerful king will allow you access to resources that would otherwise be difficult to acquire.
The church may interpret advanced technology as sorcery, and is likely to consider modern ideas heretical.
Your language, knowledge, and skills are anachronistic... but they can be adapted to be effective in a medieval context.
Many structures within the workshop cannot be constructed until you move it out of the hidden cave and into an established castle.
Your salvaged parts count represents tech components such as electric motors, circuit boards, rifled barrels, modern optics, and electromagnets.
Machine tools include precision metalworking tools such as the lathe, drill press, wire mill, press forge, or welder.
Your manual collection contains a wealth of knowledge about science, medicine, geology, history, and other topics... no electricity required.
Seed containers contain useful new world crops such as corn, tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco.
Seed containers contain modern varieties of cereal and fiber crops, bred to be hardy and highly productive.
The events at the start of a new game will allow you to define the personality of your time traveller.
Visiting the countryside during your travels is a good way to meet interesting people and learn the common languages of medieval Europe.
Armies with a significant number of gunpowder troops can execute devastating combat tactics.
Explore far and wide. Your exploration party will not encounter much if you remain in one place.
Banditry, murder, and other criminal activities while travelling may eventually catch up to you.
A workshop equipped with medical facilities can treat many illnesses and injuries.
To get the best price, sell luxury goods in large cities far from where they are produced.
Observe battles and sieges to learn about medieval war by visiting provinces in which they are occurring.
Spend time in the workshop writing treatises. Beyond the direct personal benefits, they contain information valuable to other rulers.
Writing is slowed down by a lack of gold, language skills, a working computer, a library, a paperworks, and a scholarly companion.
Some treatises cannot be written if you lack an appropriate building in your workshop.
